attributes.action: Oblige China to  abide by the 1984 Sino-British Joint Declaration on Hong Kong
attributes.background: There is evidence in the public domain that freedoms of speech, of the press and of assembly are being systematically denied in Hong Kong and that democratically-elected members of the legislature have been excluded on bogus grounds. Protests about current legislation have been met with violence.

rejection.details:
The UK Government does not have the power to require governments of other countries to take action. 

You may wish to sign the following petitions instead:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/263408
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/264610

Otherwise, you could start a new petition calling on the UK Government to urge the government of China to take a particular action.
